Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in Istanbul at Best Western Acropol”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights in Istanbul at the Best Western Acropol. We had a fabulous experience. The 5 of us arrived at 3 different times but were all met at the airport and made to feel so welcomed. The staff, starting with the Manager, Mr. Ozlu, were so warm and friendly. They couldn't do enough for us. Pinar, Ahmet and Elhan were all so very helpful but Elhan literally took the cake when he provided surprise cake and champagne (with my daughters help in arranging) for my birthday! The location is fabulous, within easy walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, Haiga Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The bathtubs with the jets in the renovated bathrooms were a real treat after a long day sightseeing and the rooms very comfortable. Breakfast was very good with a generous range of choices. Loved it and would readily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Top class customer service”
Reviews.Author: HB393
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 8 nights in Istanbul at the Acropol. From the moment we arrived from the airport with 2 little children (3yrs and 1yr) we were made to feel at home. The staff couldn't do enough to help and there were always at least a couple of people to help us with the buggy or carry shopping up to our room for us. They were fantastic with the girls and helped to provide entertainment when patience was wearing thin at breakfast time. We had a family room which was clean and had a sliding door between our (very large) bed and the sofa beds for the girls which meant the girls could sleep while we stayed up. Having holidayed in the US recently, it felt small but that is what you get staying in the old town so we cant really complain. The location is excellent and we spent the first 3 days in the immediate area sightseeing. Was expecting to be woken up early with the call to prayer but didnt hear a thing and although there are restaurants all around the hotel, there was no noise from them either in the evenings. Thank you so much for helping to make our holiday so fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “A great time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Leo L
Reviews.Content: We felt welcomed as soon as we stepped in Acropol Suites & Spa. Manager Mr. Ozlu upgraded us to an executive suite with a view of Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia. Mr. Ozlu led a group of friendly and helpful staff members including receptionist Pinar and restaurant staff Elhan. The location of the hotel is convenient to walk to all sights of interest and metro stations. There are many dinning options on the street. You should not miss the Ottoman dish- roasted meat in a clay pot. After a day of touring around, having a cup of complimentary coffee by the sidewalk or by the window in the restaurant is a good way to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul at the Best Western Acropol”
Reviews.Author: mary g
Reviews.Content: Tired from our 10 hour flight, warmly greeted and able to check into our room two hours ahead of check-in time. No request was a problem for this wonderful staff and manager. We stayed in a spacious king-bed family room which had a separate room to accomodate our teenage son. Large, beautifully renovated marble bathroom. The lovely and elegant dining room served a delicious, full breakfast every morning. Also, great spa services. LOCATION, LOCATION-literally in the shadow of the Blue Mosque and walking distance to all the major sites. Cannot say enough nice things about the staff and the manager at this hotel. They all took a personal interest in making our stay comfortable and memorable. I know where we will be staying on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Sultan Ahmet”
Reviews.Author: RidzwanShah
Reviews.Content: Very nice first impression from the meet and greet at the airport to the hotel room.An old Wooden Ottoman Mansion refurbished.A nice sight for sore eyes.One of a kind.Upgraded to premier suite with 3 balconies.Nice timber flooring and heated bathroom floor.A bit on the smaller side in terms of size but during cold season,its a bonus due to efficient heating. Wonderful and very friendly staff. Within walking distance to all the important tourist destinations at Sultan Ahmed area.Liked the cobble stone streets as well. Foodwise,breakfast was excellent.Grilled fish my favourite among others for dinner.A must try among others. Overall,one of the best hotel me and the wife had ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff gets five stars!”
Reviews.Author: Jill G
Reviews.Content: I was worried about traveling to Istanbul with a toddler, and though it was not super easy getting around, the hotel staff made our hotel experience virtually worry-free with their accommodation and friendliness. We arrived at 11 a.m., before normal check in time, hoping that the hotel would have mercy on us and allow us to check into one of our two rooms early so that we could get our little girl settled. But luckily, they quickly prepared both rooms for us and served us tea and coffee in their restaurant while we waited. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. They had a portable crib for us to use (not in the best condition, but they had one!) and it worked perfectly in our room. They did not have a working high chair in their restaurant, but we managed just fine without. Breakfast was good, had a nice variety of choices, but was more or less the same every morning, which was fine with us. Room service was good for the nights that we were too tired to entertain a toddler in a restaurant. The location of the hotel was great, as it was within walking distance to many top sights, the metro, the water, many great restaurants, and several little markets. The personnel were warm, knowledgeable, and wonderful. They learned our daughter's name immediately, and could not have been any friendlier to her. Sevgi was particularly charming and helpful. Overall, a wonderful stay. I would definitely stay at this property again on a subsequent visit.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing staff of any hotel we've stayed in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: amandaRome
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels ever!! I was nervous staying at a best western because I wasn't sure it would be as nice as we wanted, but it was a BEAUTIFUL hotel in an old Ottoman mansion. The location of this hotel was ideal in Old Town. You can walk to all the sites and have easy access to the tram. The rooms were very clean and we were upgraded to a family suite without even asking! The manager, Ozhan, was so helpful and open to answering my emails before our stay. They even arranged to pick us up from the airport. But what was most wonderful about this hotel was the staff!! They were the warmest, most generous people. They really made our stay wonderful! I'm very picky about my hotel choices, but I give this hotel my highest recommendation! If you're going to visit Istanbul then definitely stay at this hotel!! You will have an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Claude C
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, warm and cosy atmosphere. The Hotel has a real authenticity in Istanbul, very close to Blue Mosquee and St Sophia. Staff devoted to customers, very professional. Besides, all the team was nice and kind to us (particularly the receptionnist Pinar, but also the other crew). Everything went well from the beginning until the check out. What's more, we have been upgraded for free, which is always a nice gesture to customers. Room (Family suite) was thus very confortable, clean and kempt Breakfast was fresh, well cooked, and nicely accomodated. No doubt a great place to enjoy tourism in Istanbul ! Charming and character hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: theweams
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay here was perfect! The staff was very helpful and friendly. My husband and I stayed here with our 11 month old son and where made to feel at home right away. The afternoon/evening staff was a little more friendly than the morning staff but after a day or two the morning staff warmed up. Children are made to feel more than welcome. The hotel is in a great location. Very easy walk to the main tourist attractions. We walked to the grand bazar, it took about thirty min. but it was very easy and enjoyed the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: luvrockymts
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband to tour Istanbul for 3 days during the Valentine's Day week. We wanted a location that was central to the tourist area where we would not need a taxi and waste time as we could only stay for three days. We also did not want to kill ourselves with fatigue after a flight and have to 'travel' from place to place to enjoy the sights. This hotel was perfect for that! It was in central old Istanbul where the restaurants and little grocery shops were within 30 steps from the front door of the hotel. They upgraded us from a junior suite to a suite without our request. We also needed to stay till 4:00pm and they gave us the extended time for free, because it was low season. I don't think this would be possible in the high season when there are tons of tourists. But they were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff & Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: roshan a
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank you and staff for making our stay in Best Western PREMIER Acropol Suites & Spa one to remember. We really enjoyed ourselves . It was the most pleasant hotel experience we've had in these years .The location of hotel in historical sultanahmet area it is was exceptional. The hotel was one of the cleanest, comfortable, in any hotel that weâ€™ve stayed at in a long time . The staff was exceptional, friendly, professional and accommodating. thanks again for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old City Experience”
Reviews.Author: kencollier
Reviews.Content: After leaving an expensive, run down Sheraton in Istanbul's business district we resettled in the Acropol in Sultanahmet. This hotel was a perfect blend of old world feel and modern comfort and convenience. The Acropol's manager exemplifies Turkish hospitality by greeting us upon arrival and telling us about the hotel's history. Our room (401) has a beautiful view across the Marmara Sea, a comfortable bed and high quality fixtures made our stay very pleasant. The morning breakfast is excellent, and the dinner time menu is great as well. The exercise room is well equipped, and all of the major tourist sites are within easy walking distance of the hotel. I would definitely stay at the Acropol again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: hquilter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally 100-200 meters from ALL of the major sights in Sultanahmet. We walked to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Cistern, and Grand Bazaar with no problems at all. Our room (304) was a "suite," with a small king-bedded bedroom and an outer room with two chairs that fold into single beds (we used one of those, slept well). The staff is very friendly and acommodating, and eager to please. We ate dinner there, it was nothing special but fine. Breakfast is also fine, nothing special but certainly adequate. One minor cavil is that in our entire "suite" there was not one box of kleenex?! How strange is that. From the third floor you have no view -- if it's important ask for an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nov. 2011 in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FraserR11
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was wonderful - fabulous architecture, history, blend of cultures, lovely people. The Acropol was a perfect place to stay. The location is convenient to everything and the setting is a renovated Ottoman mansion. Mr. Ozlu, the manager, was exceedingly helpful and the staff were efficient and friendly. They were most helpful in arranging side trips. My room was very comfortable with a wonderful view of the sea. Breakfast was excellent with a full buffet and dishes, such as omelets, to order. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I heard about it from a friend who has stayed there on periodic business trips to Istanbul and urged me to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel in Istanbul's Crown!”
Reviews.Author: Michael10301
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a magical place- the home of Emperors, Sultans and Pashas. It is where East meets West. It is where the cuisine of the Mediterranean takes on its finest character with the influences of the Middle East. The Architecture of the sites is astounding and must be seen. So go, and when you do, stay at the Acropol. It is a small, newly renovated Ottoman mansion in the heart of Sultanahmet. All the sites are so close, a little touristy yet the neighborhood has great food and shopping as well. You are in the action but this hotel is a lovely oasis. The manager, Mr. Ozlu, and his staff treat you like family. They are efficient, friendly, and fun. My wife and I mixed an anniversary trip with a business trip and the Acropol was great for both. They helped us schedule appointments, find our way around the City and we would return to fruit,wine or flowers in our room. So even if you are on a business trip bring your sweatheart and stay here. The building is an old home so the rooms are not big, but more than adequate. Well appointed and clean. We had views of the Haya Sophia and the Sea of Marmara's confluence with Bosphorous from our windows. Our only complaint was that we had to leave but we look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a big heart”
Reviews.Author: Hetty D
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Istanbul for the first time. We did not commissioned a travel agency to book our hotel and flight. We just relied on the trip advisor's review on hotels. Best Western Premier Acropol Suites & Spa has a lot of positive reviews so we booked our accommodation there. And we were not disappointed at all. Even before the trip, Mr. OZLU, the Hotel Manager, was kind enough to answer all our email queries on tour packages and other trip-related matters. It was not only Mr. OZLU but the whole staff of the hotel were very accommodating and gave excellent service. It is also strategically located to all the major tourist attractions and just a walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Hippodrome, Grand and Spice Bazaar. We will definitely go back and stay there because the hotel makes you feel like you're at home. That's why we can say it's a hotel with a big heart. Also, we defitnitely will recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Istanbul. Cheers to Mr. OZLU and his wonderful staff. Hetty and Liza de Joya

Reviews.Title: “Striking lucky in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bullshead
Reviews.Content: One thing you discover when you browse the tripadvisor reviews for Istanbul is that EVERY hotel seems to have some bad reviews, and not just the cheap ones, meaning that you can't escape mediocrity - or worse - by paying extra. In fact, some of the reviews for the top hotels are evidence of frighteningly poor value-for-money. So the trick is to find a not TOO expensive hotel, in a good location, with useful extras (eg. spa, free WiFi), with the least poor reviews. This paid off for us at the Acropol. OK, so it's not cheap, but the location is brilliant - the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia are a few minutes walk away, and the Sultanahmet tram stop (on the T1 line) a few minutes further on from there. If you happen to be at the Eminonu end of the Galata bridge another way back to this hotel is from Sirkeci station: one stop down the B1 electric train line to Cankurturan station, which is close by the hotel. We were made very welcome, and all the staff are friendly and helpful and speak English. I e-mailed the hotel with my requirements and had a prompt and detailed reply. On the top floor, room 501 was spacious and comfortable, which I chose because it had a view across the Sea of Marmara/Bosphorus to the Asian side, meaning the sunrise streamed in through our window at first light. You can see the Selimiye Barracks where Florence Nightingale operated on the far shore. The alternative is to choose a city view, in which case I gather you can see the Blue Mosque or Aya Sofia, and at least one of these rooms apparently has a balcony, which would be nice in summer. I took advantage of the free WiFi, which worked fine. They have a spa in the basement, which includes a very nice Hamam, or Turkish bath. This was very relaxing, all the more so because it is included in the room rate. You can opt for a massage, but this is extra. We chose to eat dinner at the hotel (it was dark and raining) and this was very pleasant, although the wine was VERY expensive. Breakfast made few concessions to Western tastes and was a bit strange, but great if you've got a very sweet tooth, and don't aspire to Turkish or espresso coffee. We opted for their door-to-door private van transfer to the airport (18km, 30 euros) which was ultra-efficient and fast, rather than be at the mercy of the predatory Istanbul taxi drivers - who all wanted 20 euros to bring us the 5km from the cruise terminal behind Istanbul Modern. All in all, an enjoyable stay; when we came to leave it was like leaving after staying with friends. The bottom line is always Would you stay there again? to which the answer is Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ladhar
Reviews.Content: We came to Istanbul to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. When we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed with a smile and a soft / hot drink. Our room was beautiful and the manager had arranged for a bottle of wine for my wife. Later at dinner the staff bought out a birthday cake which completely took us by surprise as we had not requested this. The breakfast was excellent, a bit hectic some mornings but the staff always had a smile on their faces. I would recommend this hotel for families with small children. My 2 boys were made to feel very special by the staff. The main sights were all within walking distance as were the trams. We had no difficultly at all in getting around. I hope to return to Istanbul some day and stay in this hotel. Thank you to Ozhan and all his staff. From The Ladhar Family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosini2709
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 night at Acropol and we recommend it. The hotel is very well located and it is very easy to reach the mains sightseeing places. We stayed the 3rd floor in a Junior Suite and the room was very confortable and well sized. The (free) Wi-Fi works all roud with a good conection. We also tasted several restaurant arround Instabul, but in the end of our trip we discovered that the hotelÂ´s restaurant is excellent. We were very well served by the waiters which makes the difference from the others places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Penyderyn
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a very relaxing city break in Istanbul staying at the Best Western Acropol suites. The location is excellent - within easy walking distance of many of the major sights of Istanbul. The rooms (we stayed in a junior suite) were very nice indeed, spotlessly clean and the staff attentive and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful, though staff on occasion needed reminding to replenish the coffee or plates. Overall a very good hotel in an excellent location. I would recommend and return and with a little more training for staff (who are most helpful when asked), it would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: chad18
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel later than we had expected. We were given a very small room next to the lobby. The young man who booked us in could see that we were disappointed and said that we could ask for another room in the morning, as the Hotel was full. I had booked the hotel several months before, through Expedia, so I was very disappointed that one of our 4 nights was to be spent in this room, looking out at a wall, when I had paid for this booking, in full, several months in advance. Next morning we asked for another room. The desk staff were charming and offered to move our luggage into our room whilst we were out. We were given a much larger room on the third floor. We had a lovely view of the Aya Sophia Mosque. The room was very comfortable and Topkapi was only a 10 minute walk away.As it is sooclose to the Mosques, we were woken by the Call to Prayer every morning. We thought this was great- much better than an alarm clock! We were up and out early most mornings and so breakfast was a quiet affair. On our last morning, we went down after 9 and breakfast was hectic. There was one girl serving, most of the tables were full, and the meats and most other choices had run out. In addition, the toaster had broken, so toast was not an option.These were eventually replaced, but the poor girl was run off her feet. We enjoyed our stay here. Would recommend to other travellers., if given a room on the second floor or above.I would book this hotel again if we return to Istanbul. However, this is more of a good 3 or 4 star hotel, than the 5 stars Best Western claims.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a fabulous location Very clean and our room had a great balcony overlooking the blue mosque and aya sophia Ozhan the manager, pinar the receptionist were awesome The exceptional service we received was from Sergio and ilhan. They worked such long hours, but always smiled and were so gracious and hospitable. I cannot find words to describle how nice they were. Also Sergio made me the best cappuccino everday The best location in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “hotel for sight seeing in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownCapetown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Istanbul from Cape Town, South Africa. We wanted to stay in Sultanahmet even though we had read on Trip Advisor that we would be hassled by carpet salesmen and conned by taxi drivers! Well we were never hassled or conned. Turkish people are wonderfully hospitable, hard working and polite. The hotel manager at Acropol was a perfect example of this We arrived in Istanbul at 6am after an overnight flight and were met at the airport by the hotel driver. When we booked on the Best Western web site we selected to pay for this service as we knew we would be tired after all night on the plane. The drive to the hotel took about 20 minutes. When we checked in, we were offered a complimentary breakfast and the use of the shower and spa to freshen up before our day of exploring. Our room was not available so early, but our bags were stored safely and we went off to explore When we got back to the hotel about 2pm, our room was ready and we had been upgraded to a family suite. Our suite was beautifully furnished with a polished wood floor, high quality furniture and a comfortable bed. The room overlooked the old street of Sultanahmet and it was lovely to watch daily life go on below us. The hotel is small - about 24 suites in all I think. All rooms are now suites after a recent renovation of the hotel. Our booking included breakfast every day - a European/ continental style buffet with fruit and cold meats and you could order eggs any way you liked them. We ate outside on the wrap around balcony and watched the street wake up - no one hassled you at the table The staff was most pleasant and helpful. They were very knowledgeable of the area and the transport systems and were able to tell us how to get where we wanted to go. Location wise we were a 5-8 minute walk from Sultanahmet Square where you catch the trams to other areas of Istanbul. We were about -7 minutes from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and maybe 12 minutes from the wonderful Topkapi palace. We wanted to stay in Sultanahmet as we figured on our first day in Istanbul after the flight we could wander round and see the Basilica Cistern and explore the old streets but be close enough to walk back to our hotel if we were tired. On our third morning I saw there were no "Simits" on the buffet - like a pretzel made from soft bread with sesame seeds - they are sold on the streets and I thought they were delicious. I mentioned it to the waiter who said "I will buy for you" and 5 minutes later he arrived back at our table with a bag of fresh simits - great service After we left the hotel and went on to Venice, I noticed I had left a face cream at the Acropol Hotel. I emailed the manager who replied that they had found my cream and were happy to forward it on for me - great service again. I would highly recommend this hotel for location, service, beautiful rooms and fair value

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: jamila b
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Fantastic location, wonderful ambience day and night. Close to all the important sites and city centre. Room (junior suite) and bathroom were very comfortable. Service and staff are excellent. Special mention must be made of staff member Ilhan who went out of his way to offer us excellent service. Our stay in this hotel just made our stay in Instanbul perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jess6612
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here, were upgraded to Executive Suite (501) which had a fabulous view. Really started off the trip in the right way. Staff was very nice--helpful when my husband left his sunglasses in a taxi as we were leaving the hotel. Breakfast was just ok--this was the only slight disappointment. Also the hotel restaurant was not quite as good as the restaurant across the street Alburaka. But we would definitely recommend the Acropol as an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bianca72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lively street with lots of restaurants with rooftop terraces. In the rooms you can hardly hear this because of the dubble glazing. And at 12 o'clock everything is quiet anyway. All the attractions are within walking distance. We had the hotel arrange our transfer from and to airport and some guided tours and everything was organised as we requested. Staff is very friendly. If I would go back to Istanbul I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fantastic Views from Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: Dolce1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Acropol for a week in early September. The staff was friendly, helpful, and spoke English. We reserved an Executive Suite on the 5th floor (top floor). We were in room 505 which is the smallest of the Executive Suites, but was worth it for the wonderful views of the Sea of Marmara and Hagia Sophia and also for the spacious bathroom. The room was nicely furnished and very clean. The free wifi worked great and the satellite TV included English channels such as CNN and BBC. The closet was spacious and included an in-room safe. Two bottles of complimentary water were provided daily. The room was individually temperature controlled and the A/C worked great! The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were fluffy. Note that no top sheet was provided, but instead a thin blanket. The windows were well soundproofed for keeping out the street noise and the early morning call to prayer never woke us up during the week (and Iâ€™m a light sleeper). Overall, we slept great here except for the night some noisy guests across the hall returned at 1:00 AM talking loudly in the hall and then slamming their door shut. Fortunately, this only happened once during the week. The bathroom was very clean, spacious, and well-equipped. Fresh towels and wash clothes were provided daily and were of good quality. Also, toiletries were replenished daily. The water pressure in the shower was great and we never ran out of hot water. The breakfast buffet was very good and included Turkish items as well as cold meats, cheeses, breads, fresh fruit, and cereal. They will also cook you eggs to order (omelet, fried, scrambled, etc.). For beverages, coffee, tea, juice, and water were provided. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay at Acropol again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “best western acropol suites istanbul”
Reviews.Author: thomas d
Reviews.Content: This is a real find for anyone who wants a small extremely high quality hotel. The location allows you to walk to all interesting sites in the Old Town area.Request a room with a Bosphoros view.Some of these rooms have small terraces also.The bathrooms are all marble and large,the rooms well appointed and a third of the price of the Four Seasons with a much better view of the sea.The spa and workout rooms are well equipped. The staff are very professional and very simpatico.They will also arrange airport transfers for reasonable fees,a must in Istanbul for tourists.Only criticism is the restaurant food is average for the city. Tom De oxford, maryland

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shehzad S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has excellent location, walking distance from all the major city attractions.. Staff was very courteous. The hotel Mgr. and his team work as a family to provide a comfortable stay for the guests. Complementary breakfast was quiet nice. View from the higher floors 4-5 is excellent. Decent restaurant / room service menu. Rooms are generally comfortable size and very clean. But if traveling with kid select twin bed instead of queen size, it's much more spacious. I stayed in a room with a belcony overlooking Blue Mosque & Topkapi museum. Stayed for 10 days..

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest service we have experienced! :)”
Reviews.Author: Sara A
Reviews.Content: The Acropol is in a great location a few minutes walks from all major sites. The service is impeccable, it is faultless. The rooms are well sized and bathroom is luxurious. The aircon in the room worked soundlessly, and the nightlife outside was unaudiable. As we needed another bed, it was assembled straight away, perfect service. We also asked for an upgrade and we got it the next day - free of charge! if we were to go to Istanbul again, this hotel would be our first choice. Excellent on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pendragon19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it is a great jumping off point for the sights of Istanbul. Great staff who were very helpful and friendly. We were on the 5 th floor with views of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Good size rooms which were kept very clean with comfy beds. The road out side has a lot of other hotels and restaurants but this did not disturb us at all. Would recommend to visitors to instanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and love it even more”
Reviews.Author: sistinehenrico
Reviews.Content: The service at the Hotel was great, the personel very professonal and extremly helpfull in many ways. The suites were very clean and very comfortable even to a person how had a stroke and move with difficulty. The location of The Hotel is very sentral as it is in the hart of the Old City. Overall it was wonderful to say there - home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: aliceblueLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights, with our 6 year old daughter, and returned yesterday. From the moment we were picked up at the airport, to the moment we left we had a faultless holiday experience. All the hotel staff were so attentive, friendly and helpful. They made such a fuss of our daughter that she started referring to the hotel as home! Breakfasts were actually quite substantial, and I really liked the choice, and the coffee. We ate breakfast outside most mornings which was a lovely start to the day. The gym was small, but fine, and most mornings it was really empty. Toiletries were well stocked up at all times in our spotless room. The hotel is so close to Sultanahmet that even in hot August it was really easy to do a long day of exploring. It's very close to the water front, as well as good links to the tram. This was our first time in Istanbul, and we loved every minute. The quality of the hotel, and the service we received from such a great staff team really added to our experience. We will definitely be returning! Thanks very much to all the staff at Acropol.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: GavinandJo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location, just 5-10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia. The street the hotel's on is very busy and gets noisy at night but you wouldn't know it in the hotel rooms. They have air con so with the windows shut, you don't hear a thing. We stayed for 4 nights which was a good amount of time. Unfortunately, we had a medical emergency when we were in Istanbul and I couldn't thank the hotel staff enough for their attention and care - they were absolutely brilliant. My husband and I would recommend this hotel and Istanbul. There's loads to do and lots of places to explore. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful place to stay, call it home”
Reviews.Author: EasyPhysics
Reviews.Content: Hello Turkey traveler , I must have spent more time searching for the perfect hotel for our family vacation in Istanbul than the time spent on vacation. Having decided on Best Western PREMIER Acropol Suites & Spa, this was the best decision we could have made. The location to EVERYTHING was perfect. Great restaurants on your doorstep. The rooms was charming and very comfortable â€“ a great place to end a day of sightseeing. Letâ€™s not forget the staff, they made us feel as if we were house guests â€“ amazing . Donâ€™t forget to try the Turkish beverage Riki and Water, when in Turkey do as the Turks ..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: HenryXKnight
Reviews.Content: This hotel like all hotels in the area is located within 7 min walk of the main square where the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and other local interests. The Grand Bazaar and port about 20 to 25 min at a leisurely pace. What make this hotel different is good attentive service right from when they pick you up from the airport. The rooms are modern, with all mod cons and great AC. There is good sound roofing. The hotel restaurant is good. Compliments to Orhan, the staff and the always cheerful cleaners!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and recommend it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: nilgun29
Reviews.Content: Because easy check-in,friendly reception,rooms great & clean,breakfast great. Staff helpful all the time & spoke English, manager always there to help us. If it's your first time to Istanbul, its in the perfect location. Hotel was new,its not big,its a boutique hotel,and we got personalised service. We went as a family 9 people, at the end of our 4 day stay we were all happy. Pick up from airport was included for all 9 of us and we instantly felt at ease with them,there we two vans Got the rooms we asked for, rooms matched what was on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: IvaToteva
Reviews.Content: You can fill the orient atmosphere once you enter the lobby. At the same time the luxury of the hotel is amazing! You can find everything from the comfort of our days â€“ perfect design, perfect equipment, everything you need for a business and a rest! I can recommend it to all of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was brilliant !”
Reviews.Author: zlatanov_law
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, in a quiet district with sea view. Boutique appearance with boutique atmosphere. Perfect service with polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “My dream came true..”
Reviews.Author: AynaMustafaeva
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to travel to Istanbul by myself. Finally, my dream came true just recently, in June. I stayed at the Best Western Premier Acropol - which is a historical place, located in the center of Sultanahmet and facing the Marmara Sea. The experience was very relaxing and adventurous at the same time. I enjoyed the views of historic downtown Istanbul outside as well as inside, thanks to distinguished decor of the hotel.This place is the blend of hospitality, history and modern comfort. The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable, that's what matter the most. The big thank you goes to the hotel's experienced staff , by the end of my wonderful trip I was all satisfied. Thank you for making my stay comfortable and enjoyable, I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: goldenboy_11
Reviews.Content: this was a great place to stay manager gave us a free upgrade to a executive suite the room was spacious and very comfortable definatly got a good nights sleep the room had a good view of the blue mosque and of ayasofia the staff were very helpful and freindly brilliant with kids really looked after my 4 year old daughter the breakfast was very nice they made a brilliant omlette the service was also good and the room was cleaned to a very good standard every day there was no need to get a taxi as everything is within walking distance definatly would go back and stay at this hotel again thank you for a great holiday from me and my family especially aminah

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way : outstanding service at the foot of the Blue Mosque. Great value for money !”
Reviews.Author: fanfan2008
Reviews.Content: This Boutique hotel, that has been completely renewed a few months ago has a great location, five minutes walk away from the Blue Mosque, the main attractions and the tram, in a little street full of good restaurant and cafe. As for the rooms and the building itself, it is a small and charming hotel with all its pros and cons coming in a single package. Design & interior are very classy and feel very homely though with some aristocratic touch. The rooms are well equipped and beds are extremely confortable. The restaurant serves delicious and authentic turkish cuisine and the breakfast buffet is various and fresh. I found the spa and wellness center very nice and clean. Whether you wish to relax in the turkish bath or to train in the gym, you should enjoy the place. Massages was great after a long running day through the city. All the hotel staff, under the very professional supervision of the manager Mr Ozlu, are without exception, courteous and helpful. They are very keen for clients to enjoy their stay and nothing is too much trouble for them. No wonder the Acropol suite hotel had 2 awards this year. There is nothing i cannot recommend about this place. Thought i stayed in different 5 stars boutique hotels in Istanbul, the Acropol Suites and Spa became my turkish home every time i am in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Peridakis
Reviews.Content: A fabulous boutique hotel with friendly and efficient staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. Our initial room wasn't what we wanted. However they changed it immediately. The hotel is spotlessly clean and well run. Before you know it you feel like one of the family. We are sorry to leave and would recommend anyone thinking of a few days in Istanbul to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - A Real Treat!”
Reviews.Author: socal7654
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot believe my luck. At the last minute before departing on my trip to Istanbul I learned that the hotel I booked was right next to active train tracks and very noisy. I immediately did a quick search and found this under-reviewed, Best Western boutique hotel in the Sultanahmet. Before I continue with the review I want to mention that American consumers should not be put off by the average hotel brand of Best Western we envision here in the US. I have stayed at 4 Best Western properties in Europe and they all exceeded US equalivant standards. What this means is that there are great Best Western hotel values available in European travel - just a tip from an experienced traveler. Now the review of the Acropol. This hotel was completely renovated about 4 or 5 months ago and it shows. The small lobby, dining area, Turkish bath/Spa/Gym, and particularly the rooms all sparkle with newness. Really, really nice. We were upgraded, no charge, to top floor, first class rooms with balconies and views of the Blue Mosque and Hogie Sophia - Oh my! The mattresses and linens were new and very comfortable. I could go on and on about the rooms. The breakfast was extensive and quite delicious. You eat while sitting outside enjoying the morning and watching the street come alive. The location of the property is beyond compare. It is located on a very, very happening ave. with many street cafes, restaurants and local bars. In fact the hotel is located across the street from the #1 rated TA restaurant in Istanbul. I walked and saw many places in the Sultanahment, which is the distict you want to be located in as a tourist, and the street where this hotel is located is absolutely the nicest and most active. Perfect! The staff was very, very friendly and quite helpful but could use a little more seasoning regarding the typical needs of tourists in Istanbul (eg - where is the roodtop bar with the nicest view of the city, things like that). We met the owner and current President of the Turkey boutique hotel owners association. He was a very charming, helpful man concerned about our comfort and enjoyment during our stay in Istanbul. Classy guy. OK, Ok I'll stop gushing all these wonderful words of praise and just say that if you plan a trip to Istanbul in the near future this is where you want to stay. Hurry before all the great reviews starting coming through on TA and it becomes hard to get a reservation. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid view, excellent service and a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSKhursheed
Reviews.Content: Came here in June 2011 and I would definitely recommend this hotel to travelers, especially after renovation the hotel lived up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent prÄ±ce and value for 5 star exerÄ±ence!!”
Reviews.Author: pedwards49
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel refurbÄ±shment was just fÄ±nÄ±shed and has been wonderfully restored. Room numbers have been reduced to accommodate some beautÄ±que deluxe suÄ±tes. Though I was stayÄ±ng Ä±n a standard deluxe, rooms have bath wÄ±th shower plus double walk-Ä±n showers, marble bathrooms amazÄ±ng!! You could not get better at Pera Palace hotel. The staff are extremely well traÄ±ned, helpful, courteous and knowledgeabe of all your sÄ±ghtseeÄ±ng needs. The standard of food Ä±s as good as any 5 star Ä±n Europe or beyond! I would thoroughly recommend you stay here Ä±f you are comÄ±ng to Istanbul, I have never stayed Ä±n a Best Western hotel thÄ±s good. It Ä±s also Ä±n a lovely quaÄ±nt street all the maÄ±n sÄ±ghts are wÄ±thÄ±n walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance. I would also recommend you book early because I belÄ±eve on completÄ±on of refurb dÄ±scounts are beÄ±ng offerred on normal prÄ±ce.

Reviews.Title: “Complete relax”
Reviews.Author: GuzeldaSilva
Reviews.Content: my friend and i stayed at this hotel for the first time. it is a perfect location for a traveller. situated in historical center, it is just 5 min walk from Blue Mosque and main square of Istanbul. it is a boutique hotel decorated with elegant taste. you feel as you are a part of history, but at the same time it is very modern and well-equiped. you will find fitness club, gorgeous turkish bath and sauna, all decorated in typical oriental style. the hotel staff is very hospitable, helpful and attends all your requests. we had really marvellous experience in spa with overall body massage. i really advise this hotel, you will not regret and your trip to Istanbul will stay forever in your memories.

Reviews.Title: “Masters of Detail”
Reviews.Author: AcropolGuest
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 weeks at the Acropol Hotel and I could not have found a better place to stay. This is a hotel that pays attention to every detail. The the rooms are furnished nicely, you look forward to sleeping in the your comfortable bed after a long day of sightseeing and the views are great - whether of the sea or the colorful street below. It is quiet at night and during the day you hear the sounds of Istanbul. The staff is friendly and always willing to help. The restaurant serves a variety of foods and everything I tried was great. The waiter could not have been any better. The service he provided was worthy of 5 stars. For sightseeing you could not be more in the center of many of the major tourist attractions. Getting to public transportation was easy and the front desk was always willing to show you how to get to places. I cannot say enough great things about the Acropol suites. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated, upscale accommodations, central to all major sites, restaurants and public transportation.”
Reviews.Author: PAC136
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good value at in house restaurant. New spa facilities look nice, staff is friendly and helpful. Know your booking facts to ease check out confusion on final bill. Some items noted as included on check in were added as additional charges on check out. Also some charges shown in TL some in â‚¬ leading to confusion and over charging. Great street to be on with many good restaurants steps away.

HotelInfo.Name: Best Western PREMIER Acropol Suites & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik cad. No:21 (Old City) | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
